column4: Is there an easy way to get wifi going on ubuntu 12.04? I have the acer niplijy 802.11b/g/n card, but ubuntu doesn't recognize it. I tried to hook up my ethernet, but I couldn't get that to work either. Sorry, new to ubuntu.
*niplify
hwo are you online right now?
windows 7, I have a wubi install
just looking to do some building for android
there is this magnificent script for diagnosing your WiIi, I recently used it to look at my own WiFI problem: http://sourceforge.net/projects/wirelessscript/
thank you bennypr0fane, i'll check it out
do you need instructions for running the script?
yes please, I am looking on the main site now, but I haven't learned the basic terminal codes yet.
here's everything about it: http://wiki.bodhilinux.com/doku.php?id=wireless_script
thanx again
once, you've run it, post the results in the forum or pastebin them and ask someone in here to take a look at them. The script prints a very neat .txt file with results
*@manigma77_
after some research I believe I need to install the broadcom sta wireless drivers, but I can't figure out how to do it without internet
do you know the name of your wlan chip?
no
just acer niplify
that's the pc, or the chip?
thats the wifi chip as far as I know, the computer is an acer aspire
so are you in Wubi right now? and if yes, does it have internet?
no, i'm in win 7
but what about your Wubi install?
it has no internet, ethernet or wireless
can i pm you?
